intro: Taraxacum lacertosum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its yellow flower heads produce seeds with parachute-like structures for wind dispersal. Taraxacum lacertosum is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in areas with limited rainfall.
